questions.question: Before the web went mainstream, Archie helped people search for what?
answers: Entries in a human-curated web directory

questions.question: Veronica and Jughead were search tools for which pre-web system?
Which Google algorithm update is most associated with downgrading thin or low-quality content at scale (sometimes dragging down an entire domain, not just a few pages)?
Which early NCSA browser is known for displaying images inline with text (instead of popping them in a separate window)?
You want to apply noindex to a PDF (or another non-HTML file) without editing the file itself. What's the cleanest way to do it?
answers: Add a meta robots tag in the HTML head
Send an X-Robots-Tag: noindex HTTP header
Add a rel=canonical tag pointing to a different URL

questions.question: Which domain is widely cited as the first .com ever registered?
Back in the day, what crawler name was most associated with Yahoo in server logs?
AltaVista's web crawler had a nickname. What was it?
The research project that became Google was first nicknamed:
The Open Directory Project (volunteer-edited web directory) was best known as:
GoTo.com officially changed its corporate name to what (and became a major search advertising player)?
The first widely cited web banner ad ran on which site (a digital offshoot of Wired)?
Which Google algorithm update is most tied to cracking down on manipulative link building and over-optimized anchor text?
Which company ran the "Associates" program that became a template for affiliate marketing?
Google's Hummingbird Update is best described as:
answers: A filter mainly focused on unnatural backlinks
A core algorithm rewrite aimed at better understanding query meaning (semantic / conversational intent)
A system for speeding up crawling and indexing infrastructure
A local search update mainly about proximity filtering
